title: Osborne House dishes up royal recipes to celebrate Queen Victoria's 200th birthday
text:
What do you serve at a Victorian banquet? Perhaps crème de riz, mutton pies à la Windsor (Queen Victoria’s favourite), boiled potatoes with mâitre d’hôtel butter (with lemon, parsley and mustard), and an anglicised take on a vegetable curry – followed by a boozy champagne jelly with sugared grapes and apricot purée.

These are the dishes to be served at a gala dinner to celebrate the 200th anniversary this year of Queen Victoria and Prince Albert’s births, at Osborne House on the Isle of Wight. “It was decided that boar’s head with aspic jelly – which also featured on royal menus – would be less appetising to modern palates,” says food historian Dr Annie Gray, author of The Greedy Queen: Eating...
description: What do you serve at a Victorian banquet?
